description: The type of intracellular structure formed in the root system of a plant when infected by rhizobia.
The number of days elapsed since the start of an experiment.
The identification code of a flower in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same flower across experiments.
The identification code of a plant matrix (mother plant) in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same plant matrix across experiments.
The identification code of a plant in a given experiment. Equal codes may not represent the same plant across experiments.
The treatement applied to an observation in a given experiment. Equal names may not represent the same type of treament across experiments.
The number of flower buds counted on a plant.
The number of flowers oppening on a plant by day.
The linear distance between the pollen-receiving and the pollen-presenting structures within a flower. In buzz-pollinated flowers, it is the distance between the stigma and the closest anther pore.
The number of flowers counted on a plant.
The hour when a flower was visited by an animal.
Time elapsed between sucessive visits to a flower. Time zero (0) represents the first visit.
A flower-visitor phenotypic coupling index. It is calculated as the difference between the flower herkogamy and the visitor abdominal width.
The number of days elapsed until the first flowering of a plant.
The number of days elapsed until the peak flowering of a plant.
Whether a plant was flowering.
The number of placentations counted in a fruit.
Whether a plant formed fruits.
The number of leaves counted on a plant.
The number of leaf scars counted on a plant.
Whether a plant had nodules in its root system.
The linear distance between the ground layer and the upper boundary of the plant shoot.
The number of pollen grains counted on a flower stigma.
The number of pollen grains counted from all anthers of a visited flower.
The difference of pollen grains between unvisited and visited flowers.
The number of inviables seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of lost seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of viables seeds counted in a fruit.
The number of viables seeds divided by the number of placentation in a fruit.
The linear distance across the widest part of the abdomen of a bee visitor.
Maximum amplitude
Average relative peak of amplitude
Minimum amplitude
Standard deviation of average relative of peak amplitude
The buzzing time divided by the number of vibration pulses
The time taken by a bee visitor vibrating and extracting pollen grains from poricidal anthers.
the farthest angle a bee visitor moves between its landing point and the first pulse around the central anthers.
Mean angular displacement between vibration pulses
Summed angular displacement
Maximum frequency
Average fundamental frequency
Standard deviation of average fundamental frequency
The time taken by a bee visitor cleaning itself and transfering pollen grains to its scopa or corbicula.
The sum of the buzzing and the grooming times.
The linear distance between the inner margins of the tegulae of a bee visitor.
The number of vibration pulses applied to a flower by a bee visitor.
The taxonomic identification of an animal visiting a flower.
The linear distance across the widest part of the thorax of a bee visitor.
Whether a visitor had touched the stigma of a flower.
